ProjectTitle: Development of reliable ceramics for hard tissue replacements: tooth enamel-inspired interdisciplinary research
InitialFeedbackHistory: 02/07/2024 [REDACTED] [REDACTED] dmp contains most of the necessary information but will need some updating in the next versions, especially the final one. [REDACTED] suggestions: 1. [REDACTED] description I suggest to have a look at the example data table in the template on dmp.online.be and to complete your table with the missing columns. [REDACTED] column for the expected size of the data is for example an important one because the size of the data may have an important impact on the costs of storage and preservation. [REDACTED] are generating samples during your project, it is best to mention them in your data table. 4. [REDACTED] I would have a second look at the information about documentation and metadata. [REDACTED] of the information under [REDACTED] a metadata standard be used?” refers to your documentation. [REDACTED] is no metadata standard mentioned, [REDACTED] you don't use a specific metadata standard it is best to say why, for example because none exists for your specific research domain. 5. [REDACTED] storage I suggest to mention who’s managing the cloud storage solution, the snapshots and the backup of the home directory, for example KU [REDACTED] or your research group. [REDACTED] the cloud storage solution is free of charge, it’s maybe best to mention this explicitly. 7. [REDACTED] sharing and reuse [REDACTED] are no factors restricting the sharing of the data, but you say they will only be shared upon request by email which may seem a bit strange. I would certainly describe how such requests will be handled, and how people will learn of the existence of the datasets. [REDACTED] you data in RDR, the data repository of KU [REDACTED] as restricted data would show the metadata to everyone, while still allowing to share the data only on request. [REDACTED] [REDACTED]
label: good with suggestions
